Die Position

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.

In Roche’s Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development organization (pRED), we make transformative medicines for patients in order to tackle some of the world’s toughest unmet healthcare needs. At pRED, we are united by our mission to transform science into medicines. Together, we create a culture defined by curiosity, responsibility and humility, where our talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed.

The opportunity

We are currently looking for a diligent and highly motivated Research Associate with a strong industry background to join our Cardiovascular and Metabolic Diseases (CVM) in-vivo pharmacology department. In this role, you will design and execute in-vivo experiments in rodents to evaluate the pharmacodynamics, efficacy and safety of novel therapeutic candidates for cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. 

These responsibilities capture a portion of what your work will look like: 

  • Establish, validate and use disease relevant rodent models (e.g., obesity and diabetes) and readouts to support various drug discovery projects.

  • Collaboratively design and execute in-vivo studies, and interpret data from in-vivo experiments to assess the pharmacodynamics and therapeutic efficacy of novel compounds.

  • Support the development and characterization of novel in-vivo models for obesity-related comorbidities. 

  • Diligently follow national and international animal welfare laws, and align with the company's commitment to the 3Rs (Replace, Reduce, Refine).

  • Continuously improve test systems, analyses, and data evaluation. Contribute to work process optimization including data capture, storage and assay automation. 

  • Work closely with all members of the group, share duties, maintain a clean work environment and actively contribute to the positive work atmosphere within the group.

Who You Are 

You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You enjoy teamwork, diligence and efficiency. You show initiative, organize multiple tasks effectively and take pride in delivering results of high quality. You are looking for a company where you receive the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Working in a multicultural environment motivates you. As a fast learner you actively drive the quality of the requirements.

Qualifications

  • MSc/BSc in Life Sciences or completion of an apprenticeship for a research associate (“Lehrabschluss”) with at least 3 years of industry experience working with in-vivo models. 

  • Mouse work experience required; managing animal cohorts, injections via various routes, behavioral assays, mouse monitoring, tissue sampling and processing.

  • Possession of LTK 1 certification (FELASA equivalent) is highly desirable.

  • Experience in rodent models of obesity and functional readouts, such as glucose and insulin tolerance tests, body composition analysis, whole-body metabolism (Promethion), blood pressure.

  • You communicate effectively in English, both in writing and orally. Skillfully able to interact with people and have strong commitment to teamwork.

  • Excellent data management and record-keeping skills are required.

Your Location

This position is located in Basel, Switzerland.

Our commitment

Roche commits to recognising talent and aptitude. We prioritise encouraging and supporting our employees on their personal journeys by providing a safe, creative space to help them reflect, make decisions and grow in their career.


We are confident that we find the most innovative solutions by gaining different perspectives, asking and answering hard questions, and challenging the status quo. Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious yet enthusiastic way; we are devoted to building a team that represents a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

We are looking forward to your application!

Wer wir sind

Eine gesündere Zukunft treibt uns zur Innovation an. Mehr als 100.000 Mitarbeiter weltweit arbeiten gemeinsam daran, wissenschaftliche Fortschritte zu erzielen und sicherzustellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und für zukünftige Generationen. Durch unser Engagement werden über 26 Millionen Menschen mit unseren Medikamenten behandelt und mehr als 30 Milliarden Tests mit unseren Diagnostik-Produkten durchgeführt. Wir ermutigen uns gegenseitig, neue Möglichkeiten zu erkunden, Kreativität zu fördern und hohe Ziele zu setzen, um lebensverändernde Gesundheitslösungen zu liefern. 

Gemeinsam können wir eine gesündere Zukunft gestalten.

Let’s build a healthier future, together.

title: Strahlenschutzsachverständige/-r und Spezialist/-in der Arbeitssicherheit
description:
Bei Roche kannst du ganz du selbst sein und wirst für deine einzigartigen Qualitäten geschätzt. Unsere Kultur fördert persönlichen Ausdruck, offenen Dialog und echte Verbindungen. Hier wirst du für das, was du bist, wertgeschätzt, akzeptiert und respektiert. Dies schafft ein Umfeld, in dem du sowohl persönlich als auch beruflich wachsen kannst. Gemeinsam wollen wir Krankheiten vorbeugen, stoppen und heilen und sicherstellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und in Zukunft. Werde Teil von Roche, wo jede Stimme zählt.

Die Position

Der Circle “Health & Safety” an den Standorten Basel/Kaiseraugst ist mit der Beratung auf dem Gebiet des Gesundheitsschutzes und der Sicherheit der Mitarbeitenden betraut und setzt sich das Ziel, berufsbedingte Erkrankungen am Arbeitsplatz und Unfälle zu verhindern. Für das Team Health & Safety wird eine Verstärkung in den Bereichen Strahlenschutz und Arbeitssicherheit gesucht. 

Als Strahlenschutzsachverständige/-r und Spezialist/-in der Arbeitssicherheit sind Sie insbesondere mit folgenden Aufgaben betraut:

  • Erkennung und Beurteilung von gesundheitlichen Risiken in den Bereichen  Strahlenschutz (ionisierende und nicht-ionisierende Strahlung), Arbeitssicherheit und Asbest

  • Kontinuierliche Erweiterung des Fachwissens in direkten und relevanten Themen

  • Beratung und Betreuung von Roche Mitarbeitenden und Organisationen bzgl. der Umsetzung gesetzlicher Anforderungen des Strahlenschutzes (Ausbildung, berufliche Strahlenexposition, Dosimetrie, Auswahl technischer und persönlicher Schutzmassnahmen etc.)

  • Durchführung und/oder Bilanzierung des Warenflusses von radioaktivem Material (Einkauf, Versand, Entsorgung, Abgaben an die Umwelt) inkl. Gefahrgutbeauftragter für die Klasse 7 und damit verbundene Anforderungen

  • Pflegen von Behördenkontakten (Aufsichtsbehörde SUVA, Bundesamt für Gesundheit BAG, Kantonales Laboratorium Basel-Stadt KCB) inklusive Austausch und Berichterstattung

  • Beratung und Betreuung beim sicheren Umgang mit Lasern der Klassen 3B und 4 inklusive Umsetzung und Einhaltung behördlicher Vorgaben und bei der Erstellung von zugehörigen Sicherheitskonzepten

  • Unterstützung der Arbeitshygiene im Fachgebiet Asbest inklusive Führung des Asbestkatasters

  • Teilnahme in verschiedenen Gremien und Fachverbänden

Wer Sie sind

Als idealer Kandidat oder Kandidatin für unsere ausgeschriebene Position, verbinden Sie sicherheitsrelevantes Denken mit Ihrer beratenden Mentalität und stellen in diversen Aufgabenbereichen und Projekten Ihre hohe Flexibilität und Ihr belastbares Naturell unter Beweis.

Weiterhin verfügen Sie über folgende Kompetenzen und Fähigkeiten:

  • Abgeschlossenes naturwissenschaftliches Studium oder Ausbildung im analogen Bereich

  • Ausbildung zum Strahlenschutzsachverständigen (oder Bereitschaft dazu, diese Ausbildung zu absolvieren)

  • Ausbildung zum Gefahrgutbeauftragten der Klasse 7 (radioaktive Stoffe) (oder Bereitschaft dazu, diese Ausbildung zu absolvieren)

  • Ausbildung als Spezialistin / Spezialist für Arbeitssicherheit und Gesundheitsschutz (ASGS) gemäss Verordnung über die Eignung der Spezialistinnen und Spezialisten der Arbeitssicherheit oder Bereitschaft zur Absolvierung einer entsprechenden Ausbildung

  • Mehrjährige Erfahrung auf dem Gebiet des Strahlenschutzes oder im Umgang mit ionisierender und nichtionisierender Strahlung von Vorteil

  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Sie zeichnen sich durch ein hohes Mass an Selbstständigkeit und Entscheidungsfreude aus. Methodisches Geschick, Verhandlungsstärke sowie eine ausgeprägte Team- und Kontaktfähigkeit gehören ebenfalls zu Ihren Stärken.

Werden Sie jetzt Teil von Roche, setzen Sie Ihr technisches Know-how ein und gestalten Sie den Bereich 'Health & Safety' am Standort Basel mit.

Wer wir sind

Eine gesündere Zukunft treibt uns zur Innovation an. Mehr als 100.000 Mitarbeiter weltweit arbeiten gemeinsam daran, wissenschaftliche Fortschritte zu erzielen und sicherzustellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und für zukünftige Generationen. Durch unser Engagement werden über 26 Millionen Menschen mit unseren Medikamenten behandelt und mehr als 30 Milliarden Tests mit unseren Diagnostik-Produkten durchgeführt. Wir ermutigen uns gegenseitig, neue Möglichkeiten zu erkunden, Kreativität zu fördern und hohe Ziele zu setzen, um lebensverändernde Gesundheitslösungen zu liefern. 

Gemeinsam können wir eine gesündere Zukunft gestalten.

description:
Bei Roche kannst du ganz du selbst sein und wirst für deine einzigartigen Qualitäten geschätzt. Unsere Kultur fördert persönlichen Ausdruck, offenen Dialog und echte Verbindungen. Hier wirst du für das, was du bist, wertgeschätzt, akzeptiert und respektiert. Dies schafft ein Umfeld, in dem du sowohl persönlich als auch beruflich wachsen kannst. Gemeinsam wollen wir Krankheiten vorbeugen, stoppen und heilen und sicherstellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und in Zukunft. Werde Teil von Roche, wo jede Stimme zählt.

Die Position

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.

In Roche’s Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development organization (pRED), we make transformative medicines for patients to tackle some of the world’s toughest unmet healthcare needs. At pRED, we are united by our mission to transform science into medicine. Together, we create a culture defined by curiosity, responsibility and humility, where our talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed.

This position is located in TSAC, a department within the Pharmaceutical Sciences function.  We drive the non-clinical safety assessment of drug candidates from small molecules to complex biological products during the discovery and development phases at Roche.


 

The Opportunity

We are offering an outstanding opportunity for a Senior Toxicologist to serve as the single point of contact for impurities assessments at Roche Basel. The position is placed in the Translational Safety Assessment chapter (TSAC) within Pharmaceutical Sciences at pRED Basel. This is a critical role within our team, requiring a strong scientific background and excellent communication skills to collaborate across various departments. You will play a key role in supporting the safety assessment of impurities and extractables/leachables throughout the value chain from late discovery to clinical development, as well as for established medicines, with compliance to the most current regulatory guidelines. Utilizing your expertise, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the delivery of high-quality and compliant safety evaluations.

Your main responsibilities will be: 

  • You are the single point of contact for impurity and E&L risk assessments in drug substances and drug products

  • You conduct comprehensive risk assessments of genotoxic impurities in line with ICH M7 and related guidance

  • You perform toxicological evaluations of E&L profiles associated with container closure systems, devices, and manufacturing components

  • You provide guidance on thresholds of toxicological concern (TTC), supporting product compatibility and safety dossiers

  • You design and interpret in silico (Q)SAR analyses and, where appropriate, propose and evaluate in vitro/in vivo studies.

  • You draft scientifically justified TBLs for impurities, leachables, residual solvents, and raw materials

  • You apply appropriate risk assessment methodologies (e.g., AI, PDE, TTC) in accordance with ICH and EMA/FDA guidelines.

  • You support the integration of TBLs into product specifications and cleaning validation procedures.

  • You collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure control strategies are scientifically sound and compliant. 

  • You work closely with analytical chemists, formulation scientists, quality assurance, and regulatory affairs along with our Occupational Safety Teams.

  • Your evaluations will be pivotal for the release of new batches from the manufacturing and quality functions

  • You represent Roche as KOL in Industry Consortia and regulatory framework discussions groups

  • You will advise and support project teams with regard to regulatory requests in the frame of impurities and contribute to internal scientific governance and decision-making forums on impurity and safety issues. 

Who you are

  • You hold a PhD and MSc in Toxicology or a pharmacology/toxicology-related discipline and have broad knowledge in toxicology and chemistry.

  • You have a minimum of 5–10 years of experience in pharmaceutical or biotech toxicology, with strong expertise in impurity assessments and proven experience in E&L toxicological risk assessments.

  • You possess working knowledge of genetic toxicology and have robust experience in the area of QSARs, computational toxicology, and the design and application of impurity safety databases.

  • You have profound knowledge of ICH guidelines (M7, S9, Q3A/B/C/D, etc.), TTC principles, and relevant regulatory frameworks.

  • You have a broad understanding of drug development and manufacturing processes, along with strong analytical skills and a commitment to scientific excellence.

  • You possess strong communication and interpersonal skills, with experience engaging regulatory agencies (EMA, FDA, etc.).

Unwavering focus, collaborative teamwork and exceptional delivery are key behaviours that drive our mission of doing now what patients need next. Together, we can be transformative.

If you are passionate about contributing to a committed team and have the dedication to partnership and innovation, Roche is the place for you! Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference in patients’ lives. 

Apply now and join us in making an impact!

At Roche’s Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development (pRED), we transform science into medicines to address some of the world’s toughest unmet healthcare needs. Guided by curiosity, responsibility, and humility, we empower our people to deliver life-changing innovations quickly.

This role is based at the Roche Innovation Center Basel within the Pharmaceutical Sciences (PS) function, focused on developing regulatory-compliant assays for biomarkers and bioanalytics in close collaboration with therapeutic areas and functions. The position is part of the cross-functional RNAHub, where experts across biology, engineering, and data science collaborate to apply RNA-targeting technologies for drug, biomarker, and target discovery. The RNAHub’s data-driven approach blends artificial and human intelligence, fostering a collaborative, innovative research community.

The Opportunity

As an expert in the development of bioanalytical and biomarker assays required for the development of oligonucleotides and small molecules, your main responsibilities are the evaluation, development, and application of novel methodologies to analyze and quantify oligonucleotides and challenging small molecules from animal and human study samples. You are applying highly sensitive LC-MS methods in which you have special expert knowledge. You work with scientists and associates to support the development of oligonucleotides and small molecules from discovery to early development.

  • You have knowledge in the field of bioanalytical and biomarker assay development in the lab with special focus on oligonucleotides and small molecules; you develop new sensitive methods to assess the pharmacokinetics of a therapeutic compound and its biodistribution as well as selected biomarkers / pharmacodynamic markers.

  • You are an expert at applying LC-MS technologies in the lab, evaluating new technologies and helping to transfer novel methods to external collaboration partners.

  • You apply the technologies to analyze samples from pre-clinical and clinical studies and condense the results into bioanalytical reports which might become part of filing dossiers.

  • You are aware of different technologies to analyze and quantify oligonucleotides and small molecules; you help to evaluate and select the most appropriate technique for compounds of these therapeutic modalities.

  • You scout for new technologies and lab equipment to constantly evolve best practices in the lab.

Who you are

  • Master’s degree in Biology, Chemistry, Pharmacy, or technician with substantial experience.

  • 3+ years’ experience in development, validation and application of LC-MS assays for the measurement of oligonucleotides and small molecule drugs and biomarkers in biological fluids. Previous experience in quantitative LC-MS method development for large molecules is a plus.

  • Hands-on experience with relevant technologies; expert knowledge in quantitative mass spectrometry is a must.

  • Knowledge in tissue sample preparation and processing as well as in development of an appropriate quality control concept.

  • Ability to think unconventionally, applying scientific rigor in the evaluation and development of new technologies to support all current and emerging modalities.

  • High spirit of collaboration and ability to work in an agile matrix team with a sense of urgency and ability to deal with complex situations and changing timelines.

  • You exhibit a growth mindset. You ask for feedback and act on it. You embrace opportunities to gain new skills and perspectives and provide honest feedback to others to help them grow.

We are looking forward to your application!

Die Position

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.

In Roche´s Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development organisation (pRED), we make transformative medicines for patients in order to tackle some of the world’s toughest unmet healthcare needs. At pRED, we are united by our mission to transform science into medicine. Together, we create a culture defined by curiosity, responsibility and humility, where our talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed.

The Therapeutic Modalities (TMo) function is part of the Roche Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED) organization. TMo discovers and optimizes innovative drug candidates including small molecules, biologics and nucleic acid-based therapeutics with the goal of delivering novel therapeutic approaches across all pRED Discovery and Translational areas (DTAs).

We are seeking a Scientist in Synthetic Biology with a strong background in recombinant adeno-associated virus (rAAV) gene therapies to join the Nucleic Acid-Based Medicine (NABM) group within the TMo division at pRED. As a member of NABM, you will collaborate with a diverse group of experts, committed to pioneering the next generation of viral and non-viral gene therapies, utilizing design-build-test-learn (DBTL) cycles to drive innovation. Together, we cultivate a vibrant and collaborative community, continually exploring and implementing innovative approaches in our research environment.


 

The Opportunity

Your role will focus on designing and testing genetic elements utilizing synthetic biology techniques and expertise to advance the development of novel AAV-based gene therapies. You will also work in the wet lab to test and identify lead molecules for further development in the drug discovery pipeline.

Your impact:

  • You design, build, test and develop novel gene therapy payloads using computational tools and AI/ML models, focusing on large pooled library design to address disease targets.

  • You collaborate closely with disease experts to integrate genetic, RNA, and protein elements into functional synthetic systems in mammalian cells.

  • You apply advanced genome editing and cell engineering technologies to generate tailor-made cell lines for assays and screening, utilizing innovative approaches and multi-omics technologies.

  • You independently design, perform and oversee experiments, using state-of-the-art software to analyze data, inform decision-making, and guide subsequent iterations.

  • You engage with pRED disease experts to support new target proposals and take independent responsibility for experiment design, analysis, and interpretation.

  • You supervise and coach staff members to foster a collaborative and productive work environment.

  • You demonstrate scientific excellence by publishing research findings and presenting at internal and external scientific meetings.

Who you are

  • You hold a PhD in Molecular Biotechnology, Molecular Biology, Synthetic Biology or a relevant scientific discipline and have hands-on experience in AAV-based gene therapy, preferably for neurological or ophthalmologic disorders.

  • You bring experience and expertise in utilizing state-of-the-art gene editing and cell line engineering technologies, as well as a strong background in cutting-edge technologies for the generation and screening of barcoded libraries. 

  • You possess expertise in molecular biology and cell engineering (e.g., plasmid design, gene switches, RNA engineering, gene editing, library design & transformation, DNA sequencing, single cell technologies). Experience in the following techniques and readouts is also desired: FACS analysis, microscopy, cell culture automation and NGS. 

  • You bring hands-on experience with computational tools (R, Python) and with AI/ML models, for the design of genetic elements

  • You have a flexible mindset, capable of working on innovative platform approaches and diverse projects/molecules, driven by problem-solving and the generation of high-quality data packages with a sense of urgency.

  • You are fluent in English and have excellent communication and presentation skills.


 

Unwavering focus, collaborative teamwork and exceptional delivery are key behaviours that drive our mission of doing now what patients need next. Together, we can be transformative.

If you are passionate about contributing to a committed team and have the dedication to partnership and innovation, Roche is the place for you! 

Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference in patients’ lives. 

Apply now and join us in making an impact!

The DELT team lies within the Lead Discovery (LD) Department in Small Molecule Research, which is part of Therapeutic Modalities (TMo) within Roche Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED). We deliver leading-edge science to drive the success of Roche’s early pipeline discovery research activities through a strong expertise in high-throughput or focused screening platforms, DNA-encoded library technology (DELT), protein science & enzymology/biophysics, cell-based assays and biostructure determination. We are accountable for the provision of high-quality chemistry starting points for small-molecule projects and generating molecular and mechanistic insights that are critical for the advancement of discovery projects.


 

The Opportunity

We are offering a position as a Selection Scientist within the DNA-encoded library technology (DELT) team at the Roche Innovation Center Basel, Switzerland. You will be responsible for leading and executing selections as part of the  global DELT platform at Roche, collaborating with project groups from all Roche R&D centers, and pushing the frontier of selection methodology to enable DELT screening regardless of  the target class, and collaborating closely with a multitude of disciplines across small molecule research. You will also be expected to lead developments in automation and new selection techniques, integrate new modalities, and bring expertise to the future direction of DELT at Roche. You will have an active involvement in our multidisciplinary team, which covers all aspects of DELT — from library design and synthesis through screening to hit follow-up. 

Your impact:

  • You lead and execute DNA-encoded library campaigns to identify key drug discovery starting points, including planning and running experiments, data analysis, hit selection and follow-up.

  • You strategically plan and collaborate with project teams to identify novel binders for diverse targets.

  • You proactively partner with Roche R&D teams and external partners to advance and integrate cutting-edge methodologies and explore new modes of action.

  • You actively collaborate with project teams to guide decision-making and drive projects forward.

  • You utilize automated techniques for selection processes.

  • You apply computational and machine learning approaches to analyze and interpret results.

  • You engage closely  with Roche’s small molecule research discovery engines.

  • You maintain accurate research documentation using electronic laboratory notebooks.

  • You design experiments and present findings to diverse audiences.

  • You ensure a safe and compliant working environment.

Who you are 

You are highly passionate about DNA-encoded library technology, pushing the boundaries of the field, as well as discovering and taking on new challenges. 

We are looking for a highly motivated lab-based selection scientist with a strong enthusiasm for chemical biology and pushing the technology to the next step, who is interested in performing state-of-the-art research in the pharmaceutical industry. 

  • You have a Ph.D. or a Master’s degree in Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Chemistry, or a similar field. If you have a Master’s degree, you have at least 4 years of relevant experience.

  • You have proven experience in interdisciplinary project work, method development, and assay development, with a strong interest in DNA-encoded library technology (DELT) and lead discovery.

  • You have a good understanding of the lead and drug discovery process and your role in that process.

  • You possess excellent communication skills and are able to consistently present data and scientific information clearly to project teams. Fluency in English is expected.

title: strategy portfolio analyst
description:
Bei Roche kannst du ganz du selbst sein und wirst für deine einzigartigen Qualitäten geschätzt. Unsere Kultur fördert persönlichen Ausdruck, offenen Dialog und echte Verbindungen. Hier wirst du für das, was du bist, wertgeschätzt, akzeptiert und respektiert. Dies schafft ein Umfeld, in dem du sowohl persönlich als auch beruflich wachsen kannst. Gemeinsam wollen wir Krankheiten vorbeugen, stoppen und heilen und sicherstellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und in Zukunft. Werde Teil von Roche, wo jede Stimme zählt.

Die Position

 In Roche’s Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development organization (pRED), we make transformative medicines for patients in order to tackle some of the world’s toughest unmet healthcare needs. At pRED, we are united by our mission to transform science into medicines. Together, we create a culture defined by curiosity, responsibility and humility, where our talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed.

About the program

The Strategy Portfolio Career Kickstart (SPOCK) program provides an exciting opportunity to explore pRED at Roche. This two-year rotational program is designed to develop and accelerate early career high potential leaders with strong strategic capabilities. We seek individuals from a wide range of educational and professional backgrounds to strengthen Roche’s talent pool. Throughout the program, you will be mentored by a member of the pRED Leadership Team who will support you in your development. You will also have access to the Strategy, Portfolio, & Operations group leaders as well as the alumni of the SPOCK program. 

Year One

In the first year, you will primarily work within the Strategy, Portfolio & Operations group, which is responsible for optimizing the pRED portfolio through objective insights and quality decision-making to maximize R&D productivity. You will also have opportunities to collaborate with teams across other pRED functions to explore various career paths.

First year key responsibilities may include:

  • Performing business analyses in support of strategic cross-portfolio projects.

  • Planning, coordinating, and overseeing the successful completion of projects within their defined scope and timeline.

  • Supporting project teams working on molecules in early development, preparing for governance decisions and creating key deliverables.

  • Collaborating with leaders across pRED to identify potential focus areas for your second-year rotation.

  • Drive workstreams of the annual pRED strategy review conducting portfolio, capability, and strategy analytics

  • Leading and managing the development of a specific molecule project as project manager, coordinating cross-functional teams, and ensuring project milestones are met within scope, timeline, and budget.

  • Oversee governance meetings as meeting managers from molecule selection in discovery to pivotal trial decisions, and collaborate developing governance guidelines and feedback strategies in close collaboration with senior leaders.

Year Two

You will be able to choose where you make your mark on pRED by contributing on high visibility projects and senior level challenges. pRED will benefit from your leadership skills and innovative mindset throughout your second year rotation.

Examples of previous SPOCK rotations include:

  • Oncology Insights - Supporting the oncology strategy review and implementation, as well as the organization's efforts to identify external innovation trends and assets.

  • Finance enterprise partner for the Discovery Leaders Committee - Responsible for delivering on the pRED research portfolio within affordable capacity limits.

  • Product owner of core scientific technology platforms - Developing the framework for a new scientific organization to enable broader access to cutting-edge technologies.

  • Therapeutic/Disease Area Strategy and Portfolio - Developing strategic insights to lead efforts in enhancing understanding of the therapeutic or disease area direction, while ensuring alignment with overall pRED objectives.

  • Global Function Strategy and Portfolio - Driving strategic safety, toxicology and biomarker initiatives to increase the technical probability of success of our portfolio while reducing cycle time. 

  • Business development - Supporting the way the partnering organization accesses external innovation and bringing in assets for pRED 

Your profile

  • Education: Master’s or equivalent degree in life sciences or data sciences (PhD/MD and/or MBA desirable, but not essential).

  • Experience: 1–4 years of relevant work experience in the medical, pharmaceutical, consulting, or scientific industries (Time of PhD / doctoral studies not included) 

  • You show a strategic and analytical mindset with a demonstrable ability to integrate and synthesize findings from multiple sources to enable informed strategic decision-making.

  • You demonstrate excellent communication and presentation skills, you can explain your ideas and demonstrate new approaches to problems

  • You are collaborative, proactive and show flexibility to compromise, while bringing your critical thinking and insights. You are proactive, solution-oriented and have the ability to see the bigger picture.

  • An experience of influencing in a matrix organization is a real asset for this role.

  • You have a nimble mindset, are open to new ideas, demonstrate curiosity, and have a thoughtful understanding of how previous experiences have shaped your attitudes, beliefs and behavior.  

We seek individuals who view this position as a learning experience with the potential to open doors to various opportunities within Roche.

Please include a cover letter outlining why you want to work with us, your specific interest in our program, and how you would contribute to our success.

Closing date for applications: 10th of October 2025

There will be optional drop-in sessions for an introduction to the program and an outline of the application process. You can sign up for the drop in session through this form. 

Please note recruitment will be conducted on a rolling basis and we encourage applying as early as possible in the recruitment period. We’d like to let you know that our recruitment process includes multiple stages: an online assessment, a virtual interview and a virtual half-day assessment center. Please note that the evaluation period for these stages may vary depending on the number of candidates being assessed.

Planned start date: Q1 or Q3 2026

The position is temporary for two years.

Our commitment

Roche commits to recognising talent and aptitude. We prioritize encouraging and supporting our employees in their personal journeys by providing a safe, creative space to help them reflect, make decisions and grow in their career.

We are confident that we find the most innovative solutions by gaining different perspectives, asking and answering hard questions, and challenging the status quo. Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious yet enthusiastic way; we are devoted to building a team that represents a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Frequently Asked Questions

What happens at the end of the 2-year programme?

The objective of this programme is to attract and develop early-stage high-potential leaders at Roche. While it is up to each participant to secure a role, they receive strong support from their mentor and the network built during rotations. Notably, previous cohorts were successfully hired into roles within Roche, highlighting the programme’s effectiveness in launching careers.

How will I develop during the SPOCK programme?

The SPOCK programme is highly focused on your development. We provide a structure to support you in creating a development plan for your time in the programme, to help you achieve your goals and ensure your work is in line with your interests. This includes having a SPOCK buddy, and a SPOCK sponsor. Your pRED Leadership Mentor will also work with you on developing your leadership skills and make sure you are exposed to opportunities in your areas of interest. 

How are rotations determined in the SPOCK programme?

In your first year you will be based in the Program and Project Management Excellence (PPME) and the Strategy and Portfolio (S&P) teams, which provide a great overview of the key initiatives across all of pRED, so that you can find an assignment you are passionate about - whether in PPME, S&P, or beyond. You will also have time to explore opportunities for your second rotations.

What kind of exposure will I have to senior leadership at Roche?

During your onboarding, you will have the unique opportunity to meet 1:1 with the members of the pRED leadership team, and choose one of the members as your mentor. Your mentor will open doors for you to work on exciting, high-visibility projects, as well as coach you on your leadership development journey. 

How many SPOCK positions are available?

There are 8 SPOCKs positions available at one time, with 4 senior SPOCKs in their second year, and 4 junior SPOCKs in their first year. That means that we hire 4 new SPOCKs every year starting in 2-2 split with 6 months from each other.

Wer wir sind

Eine gesündere Zukunft treibt uns zur Innovation an. Mehr als 100.000 Mitarbeiter weltweit arbeiten gemeinsam daran, wissenschaftliche Fortschritte zu erzielen und sicherzustellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und für zukünftige Generationen. title: senior scientific software engineer , analytics and workflows
description:
The Position

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.

Advances in AI, data, and computational sciences are transforming drug discovery and development. Roche’s Research and Early Development organisations at Genentech (gRED) and Pharma (pRED) have demonstrated how these technologies accelerate R&D, leveraging data and novel computational models to drive impact. Seamless data sharing and access to models across gRED and pRED are essential to maximising these opportunities. The new Computational Sciences Center of Excellence (CoE) is a strategic, unified group whose goal is to harness this transformative power of data and Artificial Intelligence (AI) to assist our scientists in both pRED and gRED to deliver more innovative and transformative medicines for patients worldwide.

The Analytics and Workflows group within the Center of Excellence (CoE) is dedicated to turning complex data into actionable insights that advance drug discovery and development. We leverage cutting-edge high-throughput technologies and foundational multimodal machine learning models to analyze large-scale biological data, enabling deeper understanding of disease mechanisms and the identification of novel therapeutic opportunities. Despite advances in these fields, however, transforming raw data and computational models into meaningful biological insights remains a key challenge. In this role, you’ll work at the intersection of data science, biology, and engineering to build innovative analytical tools that bridge the gap between data generation and biological interpretation—helping unlock new avenues for scientific discovery and impact.

The Opportunity

Genentech seeks a talented and highly motivated Bioinformatics Software Engineer with expert knowledge of modern genomic data processing workflows and their application to cutting-edge biological sciences. The team you are joining supports scientists with highly scalable and reproducible workflows for the analysis of sequencing data from transcriptomic, genomic, perturbation and (epi)-genetic assays at the bulk and single-cell level. 

The primary focus of this position is to establish a suite of workflows and tools for the characterization of cell lines for our growing cell therapies portfolio. You will evaluate, refine, and productionize genomic workflows and incorporate the results into our data platform. You will make use of and are an expert in state of the art variant calling workflows and can interpret the results in a variety of biological contexts. You will communicate your results in scientific discussions, create automated reports and sophisticated data bases and tools allowing for deep analysis of cell lines. To achieve this outcome you confidently evaluate and combine open-source, commercial and in-house developed solutions. A successful candidate will collaborate with interdisciplinary teams of Software Engineers, Computational Biology and Data Scientists to develop scientific workflows and tools that make this data available to machines and humans using a variety of interfaces.

Successful candidates will meet many of the following requirements

  • You have a PhD in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Bioinformatics, or similar and 2 years of relevant experience in a clinical, academic or commercial setting. Alternatively, a Masters degree or equivalent and at least 5 years of relevant experience.

  • You have expert knowledge of a modern bioinformatics workflow language (WDL, Nextflow, CWL  or snakemake) and have deployed workflows in HPC or cloud environments

  • You are an expert in variant calling and variant interpretation from short and long reads using traditional and novel deep learning methods.. 

  • You have successfully analyzed large cohorts using an automated workflow system and were involved in all aspects of the process from data acquisition, over workflow development to data processing and interpretation.

  • You have successfully delivered multiple software projects throughout the whole development cycle (planning, implementation, testing, release, maintenance) following modern software development practices.

  • Experience in managing  data according to FAIR principles as well as tracking data lineage, ensuring data quality and improving data discovery is a plus as well as experience with data standards used by large genomics consortia.

  • You are able to break down large problems into smaller software components and can develop them independently or as part of a large team.

  • You have strong experience in the use of a high-level, object oriented programming language such as Python, Go, R or Java and a strong understanding of Linux/Unix.

  • You have knowledge of best practices for software engineering including but not limited to IaC, CI/CD, and software containerization and can develop, deploy and optimize solutions on several levels of the software stack.

  • You are comfortable working both independently and collaboratively, and with handling several concurrent, fast-paced projects.

  • You are able to execute technical projects at global scale, across multiple teams and time zones.

  • You have a strategic, analytical mindset and ability to innovate using technology to advance business goals. 

  • You have strong communication skills and can untangle and discuss complex technical tasks.

  • Prior experience in a life science or drug development environment is beneficial.

What to expect from us

  • A highly collaborative and dynamic research environment where we aim to advance the rate of scientific discovery using purposefully built solutions.

  • Access to large data sets, samples and compute resources.

  • Access to state-of-the-art technologies and pioneering research.

  • Participation in seminar series featuring academic and industry scientists.

  • Campus-like lifestyle with a healthy work-life balance.

  • Mentored opportunities to further develop professional skills.

 

The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of California is $142,500 - $264,700.  Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law.  A discretionary annual bonus may be available based on individual and Company performance.  This position also qualifies for the benefits detailed at the link provided below.

Benefits 

This position requires working onsite 3 days per week.

Relocation benefits are available for this posting.

It is our policy and practice to employ, promote, and otherwise treat any and all employees and applicants on the basis of merit, qualifications, and competence. The company's policy prohibits unlawful discrimination, including but not limited to, discrimination on the basis of Protected Veteran status, individuals with disabilities status, and consistent with all federal, state, or local laws.

title: principal scientific software engineer
description:

Despite advances in these fields, however, transforming raw data and computational models into meaningful biological insights remains a key challenge. In this role, you’ll work at the intersection of data science, biology, and engineering to build innovative analytical tools that bridge the gap between data generation and biological interpretation—helping unlock new avenues for scientific discovery and impact.

The Opportunity

Within this group, you’ll collaborate with a cross-functional team to design, develop, and deploy robust tools that empower scientists to explore, visualize, and interpret complex biological datasets and models—ranging from spatial transcriptomics and high-throughput chemical screens to real-world clinical data. While you won’t be expected to be an expert across the full technology stack, we value fluency across boundaries. Depending on your background, your work may focus more on front-end or backend engineering, and could include:

  • Engaging directly with scientists—at the bench or the keyboard—to understand and clarify emerging (and sometimes ambiguous) analytical needs

  • Identifying, evaluating, and applying emerging technologies to analyze and visualize biological and chemical data in support of drug discovery and development

  • Designing and implementing modular, extensible platforms that allow biologists and data scientists to access, share, and interpret computational results, abstracting technical complexity while enabling scientific insight

  • Building scalable, high-performance data pipelines and backend systems, including APIs and services, to efficiently process and deliver large-scale, multimodal biological data.

  • Creating intuitive, interactive visualizations that integrate diverse biological data types (e.g., spatial imaging, transcriptomic, clinical), helping scientists explore hypotheses and uncover insights

  • Collaborating across distributed scientific, engineering, and design teams to support end-to-end development—from early exploration to production-ready applications

Who you are

  • Ph.D. in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Life Sciences, Chemistry, Public Health, or a related field, with 2+ years of relevant experience; alternatively, a Master’s degree with 5+ years of relevant experience

  • Strong analytical intuition for extracting meaning from complex datasets, coupled with the ability to communicate insights effectively across disciplines and backgrounds.

  • Proficient in using Python and/or R to transform and analyze complex biological datasets, with a solid understanding of software engineering principles such as modular design, testing, and version control in collaborative, production-oriented environments

  • Experienced in building static and interactive visualizations using modern libraries and tools (e.g., D3.js, Vega-Lite, WebGPU, Plotly; Shiny, ggplot2; Streamlit, Dash, Altair, Seaborn, Bokeh)

  • Preferred expertise building intuitive front-end applications using modern JavaScript or TypeScript frameworks (e.g., Svelte, Vue, React), with seamless integration of interactive web-based visualizations (e.g., D3.js, WebGL, WebGPU)

  • Preferred experience in backend development with Python, including building scalable APIs using frameworks such as FastAPI and GraphQL

  • Preferred familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)

  • Comfortable collaborating with AI/ML scientists to integrate outputs from machine learning models—such as embeddings, classifications, or generative outputs—into user-facing tools that enable model interpretability and interaction

  • Bonus: Experience designing tools or workflows that leverage AI—such as LLMs or agentic systems—to assist with biological data exploration and interpretation

  • Curious, eager to grow new skills, and excited to explore emerging technologies while collaborating across diverse, multidisciplinary teams

The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of California is $162,600 and $ 302,000.  Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law.  A discretionary annual bonus may be available based on individual and Company performance.  This position also qualifies for the benefits detailed at the link provided below.

Benefits

As an RNA Biology Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in the Nucleic-acid-based medicines team. Your primary role will be to support the RNAhub screener team with high throughput PCR and NGS based assays.

  • Design, optimize, and execute advanced molecular biology assays, including various NGS-based techniques.

  • Analyze and interpret complex data to draw meaningful conclusions and support therapeutic development.

  • Manage assays such as qPCR end-to-end to support portfolio and platform projects.

  • Collaborate with bioinformatics and molecular biology experts to integrate data analysis and experimental results.

  • Rapidly test and validate early hypotheses to justify new therapeutic projects.

Act as a mentor and leader within the product management team, fostering a culture of continuous learning, improvement, and collaboration.

Die Position

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.

In Roche’s Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development organization (pRED), we make transformative medicines for patients in order to tackle some of the world’s toughest unmet healthcare needs. At pRED, we are united by our mission to transform science into medicines. Together, we create a culture defined by curiosity, responsibility and humility, where our talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed.

Neuroscience & Rare Diseases represent a major focus area where we are committed to realizing our long-term vision of changing lives of patients with severe brain disorders. Our preclinical research and early clinical development activities center around large and rare indications. With unparalleled strengths across diverse disciplines, Roche is uniquely positioned to lead in transforming science into medicines for patients with disorders of the nervous system.

To achieve our goals, we are seeking a Medical Director, focusing on multiple sclerosis.  

The Opportunity

In this role, you will lead and/or support early-stage clinical projects from entry into a human through proof of mechanism and proof of concept, to transform molecules into new medicines in an area with huge unmet medical needs.

You will leverage your expertise to translate innovative molecules into potentially transformative therapies for patients with severe brain disorders. By marrying science and strategy, you will design rigorous and efficient clinical experiments that will support robust decision-making, to get promising therapies to patients as soon as possible.

Your main responsibilities are:

  • Lead and/or support cross-functional teams to design and execute clinical development plans from Phase 1 through Phase 2 (proof-of-concept)

  • Coach Clinical Scientists in a line- or functional-manager status

  • Closely interface with project team leaders as well as safety, clinical pharmacology, clinical operations, biostatistics, regulatory, research and biomarker groups and other members of project teams

  • Lead and/or support internal stakeholder management and governance interactions around project plans and therapeutic area strategy

  • Lead and/or support external engagements with advisory boards, site investigators, health authorities, and other key stakeholders

  • Provide clinical input to programs in discovery research

  • Lead scientific communications and disseminate the results of clinical trials in the form of conference presentations and journal publications

Who you are

  • You have an MD or MD/PhD with a speciality in neuroimmunology, multiple sclerosis, or a similar field. Board certification and fellowship training or research experience in relevant areas is preferred.

  • You bring at least 5 years of experience in longitudinal clinical research, preferably in drug development or clinical trials. 

  • You hold a strong track record of scientific excellence in the field, evidenced by substantial achievement in designing and implementing clinical trials and/or a high level of scholarship in industry or academia.

  • You have experience in clinical drug development within the industry, ideally in the early stages of clinical development. 

  • As a leader, you will work within a matrix environment where influencing and inspiring others to strive for excellence is expected.

Ready to take the next step? We'd love to hear from you. Apply now to explore this exciting opportunity!

In Vivo Sciences is responsible for the Animal Care and Use Program in pRED and thus a key business enabler for all in vivo studies.


 

The Opportunity

We are seeking a motivated and skilled In Vivo Laboratory Technician to join our Ophthalmology research team within the In Vivo Sciences Chapter of Pharmaceutical Sciences (PS). In this role, you will contribute to preclinical studies in rodents and rabbits, supporting research in toxicology, safety, efficacy, and pharmacokinetics/pharmacodynamics (PK/PD).

Your impact: 

  • You participate in ocular studies in rodents and rabbits.

  • You administer compounds via various routes (topical, intravitreal, intravenous, oral).

  • You collect blood, eye fluid (serial), and eye tissue (terminal) samples.

  • You perform a range of specialized techniques and utilize advanced equipment, including: Ocular observations (Slit lamp), Intraocular pressure (IOP) measurements, Optical coherence tomography (OCT)

  • You assist with or perform surgical procedures, including anaesthesia, and provide pre- and postoperative care.

  • You participate in weekend husbandry and study activities on a rotational basis.

  • You ensure compliance with cantonal and institutional animal welfare regulations.


 

Who you are

  • You have at least 3 years of experience as a laboratory technician, veterinary nurse (e.g., Tiermedizinische Praxisassistentin (TPA)), or in a related field.

  • You bring hands-on experience with ocular procedures, which is essential.

  • Experiences in preclinical in vivo studies and training in animal handling according to Swiss animal welfare legislation (LTK1) are advantageous.

  • You are fluent in written and spoken English; German is a plus. 

  • You are committed to animal welfare, possess strong teamwork skills, and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment.

Unwavering focus, collaborative teamwork and exceptional delivery are key behaviours that drive our mission of doing now what patients need next. Together, we can be transformative.

title: head of procurement strategic programs execution
description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections,  where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.

Global Procurement proactively manages the entire supplier ecosystem, making a vital contribution to improving health outcomes, reducing costs for patients and global healthcare systems, and ensuring that Roche continues doing now what patients need next.

The Opportunity

The Head of Procurement Strategic Programs Execution is a leadership team role that sits within the Strategy & Solutions Chapter. Our purpose is to guide strategic priorities, advance value delivery through solutions and digital excellence, govern compliance and drive sustainability to deliver continuous improvement and strengthen Global Procurement’s impact on the wider Roche organisation. The Strategic Programs Execution team is dedicated to driving complex procurement-led programs that deliver high impact benefits for Roche and result in a step change in how we work with suppliers, use technology, partner with the business or collaborate with each other in Procurement. 

In partnership with Global Procurement and business teams, they accelerate and enhance the delivery of GP led strategic programs.

You’ll operate in a dynamic global environment, leading the Strategic Programs Execution team by providing vision, leadership, capability development, prioritisation of the initiative pipeline and ensuring successful program delivery.  

  • You will lead, coach and guide a medium sized team of Strategic Programs Managers ensuring the best allocation of your people to ensure flexibility, talent development, and excellence in execution, outcomes delivery, and performance.

  • You utilise in depth knowledge and expertise in Procurement-led productivity, optimisation and change programs to provide thought leadership, advice, and know-how on relevant capability topics, strategies, and best practices. 

  • You will define and shape the vision and priorities of the Procurement Strategic Programs Execution team, focusing on transformative initiatives such as strategic sourcing, high-impact negotiations, procurement technology advancements and operating model updates.You drive the delivery and continuous improvement of Procurement-led productivity, optimisation and change programs while coaching team members and exemplifying agile behaviors.

  • You serve as a catalyst, guiding the alignment and co-creation of improvements to GP-led strategic programs while developing a well-prioritised portfolio of initiatives.

  • You work in a matrix setup with capability teams, networks, and squads/project teams to ensure prioritisation and delivery of initiatives. 

  • Acting as a role model, demonstrating curiosity, passion, an entrepreneurial spirit, enterprise thinking, inclusive collaboration, and desire for continuous learning.

Who you are

  • You hold a university degree (preferably in  business or life sciences) with extensive procurement and/or management consulting experience, ideally within a matrix organisation. You should have in-depth expertise in leadership, program management and delivery capabilities.

  • Proven success in building, cultivating, and managing large, global, and senior teams. You also have a strong understanding of the end-to-end procurement value chain.

  • Deep knowledge and experience in delivering organisational-level change, such as major procurement change programs across various categories or significant changes to processes and technology. 

  • A resourceful and action-oriented mindset, able to make decisions and influence others, prioritising the repurposing of existing ideas over starting from scratch. You're also open-minded and willing to experiment with new ideas, focusing on continuous learning and improvement.

  • Excellent leadership, communication, conflict resolution, and influencing skills. You're an enterprise thinker who proactively collaborates with colleagues to create solutions for customers.

This role is based onsite at our Welwyn UK office, or our Basel Switzerland office.

We look forward to your application!

Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.


Let’s build a healthier future, together.

The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of Roche Products Ltd. At Roche Products we believe diversity drives innovation and we are committed to building a diverse and flexible working environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion or belief, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, disability or age. We recognise the importance of flexible working and will review all applicants’ requests with care. At Roche difference is valued and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer where you are encouraged to bring your whole self to work.

title: Laborant für Mikrobiologie
description:
Bei Roche kannst du ganz du selbst sein und wirst für deine einzigartigen Qualitäten geschätzt. Unsere Kultur fördert persönlichen Ausdruck, offenen Dialog und echte Verbindungen. Hier wirst du für das, was du bist, wertgeschätzt, akzeptiert und respektiert. Dies schafft ein Umfeld, in dem du sowohl persönlich als auch beruflich wachsen kannst. Gemeinsam wollen wir Krankheiten vorbeugen, stoppen und heilen und sicherstellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und in Zukunft. Werde Teil von Roche, wo jede Stimme zählt.

Die Position

Sind Sie bereit für eine spannende Karriere bei Roche? Die Unit „QC mEMT Basel and Water Systems“ ist ein Teil der Sektion Mikrobiologie innerhalb der Quality Unit in Kaiseraugst.

Als Laborant der Gruppe „QC mEMT Basel and Water Systems“ in der pharmazeutischen Qualitätskontrolle gewährleisten Sie ein zuverlässiges und effizientes mikrobiologisches Umgebungsmonitoring für unsere produzierenden Kunden am Standort Basel für die Sicherheit unserer Produkte und somit für das Wohl der Patienten.

Die Möglichkeit

  • Vorbereitung und Durchführung des Musterzugs von mikrobiologischen Proben (z.B. Luftkeimsammlungen, Oberflächenabklatsche) und von Partikelmonitoring in den Reinräumen.

  • Durchführung von mikrobiologischen und chemisch-physikalischen Probenahmen von Reinmedien (z.B. WFI, Gase).

  • Durchführung von Filtrationen von verschiedenen Wasserqualitäten (z.B. WFI, PW).

  • Bebrütung, Auswertung und Dokumentation der Ergebnisse im LIMS.

  • Durchführung der Muster-Logistik.

  • Die Tätigkeiten werden nach allgemeinen Anweisungen selbständig durchgeführt, unter Einhaltung aller GMP-/ SOP- und gesetzlichen Vorschriften

  • Zur Aufrechterhaltung eines qualifizierten Laborbetriebes stellen Sie sowohl die Ordnung und Sauberkeit im Labor als auch die Eignung verwendeter Prüfmittel und Verbrauchsmaterialien sicher

  • Beteiligung an einem Wochenenddienst


 

Wer Sie sind

  • Sie weisen eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung (Biologie-, Chemielaborant/in, Chemie-/Pharmatechnologe/in oder gleichwertige Ausbildung) auf.

  • Erfahrungen in der Laborarbeit der Mikrobiologie sowie Erfahrungen auf dem Gebiet des mikrobiologischen Umgebungsmonitorings sind von grossem Vorteil.

  • Zudem verfügen Sie über fliessende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sowie über Englisch-Kenntnisse.

  • Sie arbeiten sorgfältig und genau und schätzen Teamarbeit.

  • Erfahrungen mit GMP (-Dokumentation) und deren System sind gewünscht

  • Eine sorgfältige Arbeitsweise und praktisches Geschick zeichnen Sie aus

  • Teamfähig, flexibel, belastbar und konfliktfähig

Das Arbeitspensum für diese Position beträgt 70–100%.

Bereit für den nächsten Schritt? Wir freuen uns darauf, von dir zu hören. Bewirb dich jetzt, um diese spannende Möglichkeit zu entdecken!

Wer wir sind

Eine gesündere Zukunft treibt uns zur Innovation an. Mehr als 100.000 Mitarbeiter weltweit arbeiten gemeinsam daran, wissenschaftliche Fortschritte zu erzielen und sicherzustellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und für zukünftige Generationen. Durch unser Engagement werden über 26 Millionen Menschen mit unseren Medikamenten behandelt und mehr als 30 Milliarden Tests mit unseren Diagnostik-Produkten durchgeführt. Wir ermutigen uns gegenseitig, neue Möglichkeiten zu erkunden, Kreativität zu fördern und hohe Ziele zu setzen, um lebensverändernde Gesundheitslösungen zu liefern. 

Gemeinsam können wir eine gesündere Zukunft gestalten.

title: Calibration Coordinator
description:
Bei Roche kannst du ganz du selbst sein und wirst für deine einzigartigen Qualitäten geschätzt. Unsere Kultur fördert persönlichen Ausdruck, offenen Dialog und echte Verbindungen. Hier wirst du für das, was du bist, wertgeschätzt, akzeptiert und respektiert. Dies schafft ein Umfeld, in dem du sowohl persönlich als auch beruflich wachsen kannst. Gemeinsam wollen wir Krankheiten vorbeugen, stoppen und heilen und sicherstellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und in Zukunft. Werde Teil von Roche, wo jede Stimme zählt.

Die Position

Pharma Technical Development (PTD) bringt bahnbrechende Therapien aus der klinischen Phase auf den Markt, um jeden Patienten zu bedienen - und dies jeden Tag. Unser Kerngeschäft ist die Entwicklung sicherer, innovativer und wirksamer Arzneimittel unter Einsatz modernster Technologien für Herstellungsverfahren (Wirkstoff und Arzneimittel), klinische Versorgung, Formulierung, Verpackung und analytische Entwicklung. 

Das Drug Product Clinical Supply Center (Parenterals) befasst sich mit der Herstellung von klinischen Prüfpräparaten zur parenteralen Applikation (Spritzen, Vials für flüssig & lyophilisierte Produkte) unter Anwendung moderner und hoch automatisierter Abfüllanlagen. Der Betriebsbereich beliefert hierbei weltweit klinische Studien der Phasen I, II & III ausgehend aus dem reichhaltigen R&D Portfolio an neuen, innovativen und hochaktiven Arzneistoffen.

Die Möglichkeit:

Als Calibration Coordinator sind Sie als Teil des Teams für die Sicherstellung des cGMP-Status der Herstellanlagen und Analysegeräten im Drug Product (DP) Bereich verantwortlich.

Als Teil eines Expertenteams kalibrieren Sie bestehende Systeme, lösen technische Problemstellungen und koordinieren die Kalibriertätigkeiten.

  • Kalibrierung und Dokumentation: Durchführung von Kalibrierungen an Herstellanlagen und Analysegeräten im Drug Product (DP) Bereich und deren GMP-gerechte Dokumentation.

  • Koordination und Planung: Koordination von Kalibrier-Aktivitäten in Abstimmung mit internen Partnern sowie Organisation externer Dienstleister.

  • Verwaltung von Prüfmitteln: Verantwortlich für die Verwaltung der Prüfmittel, einschließlich Einführung, Zertifizierung und Stilllegung.

  • Qualitätsmanagement: Erstellung/Bearbeitung von Deviations, Root Cause Analysen (RCA), Corrective & Preventive Actions (CAPA), Changes sowie Kalibrier-Konzepten und GMP-Vorschriften.

  • Datenpflege und Systeme: Pflege von Kalibrier-Stammdaten in SAP sowie Mitarbeit bei Inbetriebnahmen und Qualifizierungen neuer Anlagen.

  • Troubleshooting und Optimierung: Bearbeitung technischer Anlagenstörungen, Prozessabweichungen, Optimierungsvorschläge und Durchführung von Trouble Shootings.

  • Behörden- und Auditunterstützung: Fachliche Expertise und Unterstützung bei Behördeninspektionen und Audits.

​

Wer du bist:

  • Offenheit und Teamarbeit: Sie hinterfragen konventionelle Denkmuster, schätzen Diskussion und Zusammenarbeit in einer leistungsorientierten und respektvollen Umgebung.

  • Ausbildung / Studium: Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung im technischen oder pharmazeutischen Bereich (z. B. Pharmakant, Chemikant, Automatiker) oder Studium in Life Science/Engineering (z. B. Pharmazie, Biotechnologie, Verfahrenstechnik).

  • Erfahrungen und Fachkenntnisse: Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der pharmazeutischen Industrie, im GMP-Umfeld und idealerweise im aseptischen Bereich. Technisches Verständnis für pharmazeutische Anlagen und deren Automatisierung.

  • Spezifische Kompetenzen: Erfahrung in der Kalibrierung von pharmazeutischen Messgeräten sowie in der Bearbeitung von Deviations, RCA, CAPAs, Changes und GMP-Vorschriften.

  • Persönliche Qualitäten: Verantwortungsbewusstsein, exakte Arbeitsweise, Zuverlässigkeit unter Zeitdruck sowie Flexibilität und Eigeninitiative.

  • IT-Kenntnisse: Sichere Anwendung von Standard-PC-Programmen und produktionsunterstützenden IT-Systemen wie Veeva, SAP, ELVIS oder Kalibrierprogrammen.

  • Sprachkenntnisse: Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse.

Wer wir sind

Eine gesündere Zukunft treibt uns zur Innovation an. Mehr als 100.000 Mitarbeiter weltweit arbeiten gemeinsam daran, wissenschaftliche Fortschritte zu erzielen und sicherzustellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und für zukünftige Generationen. Durch unser Engagement werden über 26 Millionen Menschen mit unseren Medikamenten behandelt und mehr als 30 Milliarden Tests mit unseren Diagnostik-Produkten durchgeführt. Wir ermutigen uns gegenseitig, neue Möglichkeiten zu erkunden, Kreativität zu fördern und hohe Ziele zu setzen, um lebensverändernde Gesundheitslösungen zu liefern. 

Gemeinsam können wir eine gesündere Zukunft gestalten.

title: head of brand & governance
description:
Bei Roche kannst du ganz du selbst sein und wirst für deine einzigartigen Qualitäten geschätzt. Unsere Kultur fördert persönlichen Ausdruck, offenen Dialog und echte Verbindungen. Hier wirst du für das, was du bist, wertgeschätzt, akzeptiert und respektiert. Dies schafft ein Umfeld, in dem du sowohl persönlich als auch beruflich wachsen kannst. Gemeinsam wollen wir Krankheiten vorbeugen, stoppen und heilen und sicherstellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und in Zukunft. Werde Teil von Roche, wo jede Stimme zählt.

Die Position

Who we are

Group Communications (GC) is responsible for creating a lasting positive image of Roche and are representing the company's voice on a Group level: We communicate Roche’s strategy and how we deliver on our purpose of “Doing now what patients need next” to Roche colleagues and external audiences. We drive integrated and global campaigns and provide platforms for communications business partners as well as our affiliates to engage with audiences. We contribute to building trust of key stakeholders, to managing Roche’s brand and reputation and to building a favourable environment for our business. We aspire to be: innovative; forward-looking; creative; courageous; representing a strong, integrated corporate brand and audience experience. We work in an environment where people can thrive, learn new skills, create great things and have fun together.

Our communications vision is ambitious and simple: We inspire the world about Roche’s contribution to people’s health.

The Brand & Digital Experience Centre of Excellence (CoE) is where creativity, insight and technology come together to shape how the world experiences Roche. Our mission is to turn brand into experience – delivering powerful storytelling, seamless digital platforms, and campaigns that build trust, inspire connection, and advance health. Bringing together expertise across brand, governance, creative, intelligence, channels and campaigning, we enable Roche to communicate with clarity and impact, helping our stakeholders see, feel and believe in our contribution to people’s lives.

The Position

As the Head of Brand & Governance, you will be the global guardian of Roche’s brand and digital governance frameworks. This senior leadership role is responsible for setting the strategic guardrails of the masterbrand while ensuring our digital channels, assets, and publishing practices are governed with clarity, compliance, and accessibility.

You will oversee the brand system - architecture, identity, guidelines - and lead governance processes across platforms, accessibility, and asset lifecycle management. You will be a member of the Brand Council, ensuring that brand decisions are transparent, data-driven, and enable both control and creativity. You will report to the Head of Brand & Digital Experience and serve as a member of the CoE leadership team.

Your Opportunities

  • Define and steward the Roche masterbrand globally.

  • Support the overarching definition of Roche’s brand strategy and positioning, in collaboration with the Reputation Team.

  • Lead the brand architecture and naming system, ensuring simplicity and coherence across divisions, products, and initiatives.

  • Own and evolve the enterprise tone of voice and visual identity system foundations.

  • Oversee the creation and updating of brand guidelines, policies, and standards, ensuring adoption across affiliates and agencies.

  • Govern exceptions and waivers through the Brand Council and act as co-chair for its decision-making process.

  • Drive brand adoption and training programmes globally, supporting affiliates and partners to apply the brand effectively.

  • Establish and enforce co-branding and partnership rules for alliances, sponsorships, and influencer engagements.

  • Ensure compliance and consistency through formal review gates, audits, and advisory support.

  • Lead Roche’s digital governance framework, defining standards for channel usage, publishing, and platform compliance.

  • Drive streamlining of the digital landscape, consolidating and cleaning up platforms for efficiency and compliance. 

  • Oversee the Digital Asset Management (DAM) lifecycle - taxonomy, metadata, rights, ingestion, and retirement.

  • Provide agency governance oversight, ensuring partners adhere to Roche’s brand and governance standards.

  • Collaborate with our Intelligence Team to monitor brand health, consistency, and adoption across geographies.

Who you are

You are a strategic brand and governance leader with a proven track record in managing global identity systems and digital standards. You bring:

  • 10+ years of experience in brand management, corporate communications, and/or digital governance in a complex, global environment.

  • 5+ years of leadership experience, including leading diverse and multicultural teams.

  • Deep expertise in brand strategy, governance, and architecture, with the ability to simplify complexity into clear systems.

  • Strong understanding of visual identity systems (logos, grids, typography, imagery, motion) and their role in building equity.

  • Experience designing and running digital governance frameworks — policies, compliance, accessibility, and asset lifecycle management.

  • Track record of driving brand adoption across large, complex organisations and global partner networks.

  • Excellent interpersonal and influencing skills, with the ability to align senior stakeholders and inspire confidence.

  • Fluency in English (written and spoken); other languages are an advantage.

Location: Basel is the primary location. Additional locations may be considered at the hiring manager’s discretion.

Eine gesündere Zukunft treibt uns zur Innovation an. Mehr als 100.000 Mitarbeiter weltweit arbeiten gemeinsam daran, wissenschaftliche Fortschritte zu erzielen und sicherzustellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und für zukünftige Generationen. description:
