Die Position

Who we are

Group Communications (GC) is responsible for creating a lasting positive image of Roche and are representing the company's voice on a Group level: We communicate Roche’s strategy and how we deliver on our purpose of “Doing now what patients need next” to Roche colleagues and external audiences. We drive integrated and global campaigns and provide platforms for communications business partners as well as our affiliates to engage with audiences. We contribute to building trust of key stakeholders, to managing Roche’s brand and reputation and to building a favourable environment for our business. We aspire to be: innovative; forward-looking; creative; courageous; representing a strong, integrated corporate brand and audience experience. We work in an environment where people can thrive, learn new skills, create great things and have fun together.

Our communications vision is ambitious and simple: We inspire the world about Roche’s contribution to people’s health.

The Brand & Digital Experience Centre of Excellence (CoE) is where creativity, insight and technology come together to shape how the world experiences Roche. Our mission is to turn brand into experience – delivering powerful storytelling, seamless digital platforms, and campaigns that build trust, inspire connection, and advance health. Bringing together expertise across brand, governance, creative, intelligence, channels and campaigning, we enable Roche to communicate with clarity and impact, helping our stakeholders see, feel and believe in our contribution to people’s lives.

The Position

As the Head of Creative Solutions, you will lead Roche’s global communications creative capability. This senior leadership role is responsible for shaping and delivering the creative expression of the brand, ensuring that every campaign, channel, and piece of content is engaging, high-quality, and audience-centric.

You will oversee creative concepting, design, production, and quality control across formats and platforms. You will lead the Creative Solutions team, manage partnerships with agencies and production houses, and run Roche’s creative sandbox - where new ideas and visual approaches are tested. You will work hand-in-hand with Brand, Campaigns, Channels, and Intelligence colleagues to ensure creative work both inspires audiences and strengthens Roche’s reputation. You will report to the Head of Brand & Digital Experience and serve as a member of the CoE leadership team.

Your Opportunities

  • Lead Roche’s creative vision and expression, ensuring all outputs are distinctive, compelling, and audience-centred.

  • Translate brand strategy and guidelines into world-class creative concepts and storytelling frameworks.

  • Oversee creative development, production, and delivery across design, video, motion, photography, illustration, and copy.

  • Define and ensure standards for craft quality and creative excellence across all outputs.

  • Lead Roche’s creative innovation sandbox, testing new formats, visual styles, and techniques that push expression forward.

  • Build and maintain global templates, toolkits, and design systems in partnership with Brand colleagues.

  • Ensure accessibility, inclusivity, and cultural relevance are embedded in creative outputs.

  • Manage and oversee Roche’s creative agency ecosystem, setting standards for briefs, quality, and alignment with brand.

  • Partner with Campaigns to bring integrated creative campaigns to life, ensuring coherence across channels and geographies.

  • Collaborate with Intelligence to monitor and optimise creative effectiveness (resonance, engagement, recall).

  • Lead, coach, and develop a global team of creatives, fostering a culture of inspiration, experimentation, and high performance.

Who you are

You are a seasoned creative leader with a passion for storytelling, design, and craft. You bring:

  • 10+ years of experience in creative direction, design, or content production, ideally in a corporate or agency setting with global scope.

  • 5+ years of leadership experience, including leading creative teams across formats and geographies.

  • Proven ability to develop and deliver creative concepts that connect with diverse audiences and strengthen reputation.

  • Strong expertise in visual and narrative storytelling across multiple formats (design, video, photography, motion, copy).

  • Demonstrated ability to manage and inspire agency and production partners, ensuring alignment and excellence.

  • Experience running innovation pilots to evolve creative expression within brand frameworks.

  • Strong understanding of accessibility and inclusivity principles in creative expression.

  • Excellent collaboration skills, able to partner effectively with Brand, Campaigns, Channels, and Intelligence colleagues.

  • A leadership style that inspires creativity, fosters experimentation, and champions both people and craft.

  • Fluency in English (written and spoken); other languages are an advantage.

Location: Basel is the primary location. Additional locations may be considered at the hiring manager’s discretion.

At pRED, we are united by our mission to transform science into medicines. Together, we create a culture defined by curiosity, responsibility and humility, where our talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed.

Join the RNAHub, an interdisciplinary initiative within pRED’s Therapeutic Modalities (TMo) NABM team, dedicated to advancing oligonucleotide therapeutics (ONTs). We are a dynamic, collaborative group of scientists tackling complex challenges in ONT research through cross-functional innovation.

You are a cross-disciplinary specialist in the chemistry and design of siRNA therapeutics and are keen to apply your deep scientific expertise to the advancement and development of our ONT discovery pipeline.   • Support the various approaches to tap into external innovation including scouting, due diligence and feasibility assessments. 


 

Who you are

The 360 Labs are a new capability that is currently being built up within the Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development organization (pRED). The 360 Labs will deliver core scientific technologies, expertise and enabling activities, as well as facilitate knowledge sharing in close collaboration with our therapeutic areas and functions. Our goal is to act as an highly integrated ecosystem, supporting research and development, working collaboratively, and focused on fostering excellence and sustainability. You will implement automated sample preparation workflows for various applications in genomics, mass spectrometry and flow cytometry. You will be part of a team together with one senior lab automation scientist and one lab automation intern.

  • Translate and implement user requirements from manual protocols to automated assays on liquid handling robots. Partner with research teams to develop and adapt  our automation strategy.

  • Support daily operation of automation systems by training platform staff and troubleshooting.

  • Connect and integrate automation systems with internal databases and digital workflow tools.

  • Embrace a continuous learning mindset by actively engaging with the scientific literature and expert communities.

Who you are

  • You have a Master’s or a PhD degree in Biotechnology, Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, or a related field, with at least 2 years of experience in lab automation.

  • You are proficient in both the operation and programming of liquid handling systems, preferably on Hamilton Venus software. Additional experience with coding in other programming languages like Python or C# is desired.

  • You have worked in a life-science laboratory with hands-on experience in molecular biology techniques.

Die Position

Healthcare is evolving, and Global Procurement is responding by continuously striving for the highest possible performance, taking innovative and strategic approaches to business and supplier partnerships.  Global Procurement proactively manages the entire supplier ecosystem, making a vital contribution to improving health outcomes, reducing costs for patients and global healthcare systems, and ensuring that Roche continues doing now what patients need next.

The Opportunity

This role sits within the Materials Manufacturing and Capex (MMC) Delivery group and is part of the MMC Leadership Team. MMC Delivery covers the core procurement activities from category management, strategic and operational sourcing, supplier management, contracting, content strategy definition, and execution. It comprises categories of the same value chain or having commonality e.g. Research and Lab Materials, CAPEX / Engineering, Direct Materials, External Manufacturing and Logistics. The communities are key enablers of strong category expertise while allowing flexibility in the procurement delivery response to the evolving needs of our customers.

As a Contracts Lead in MMC, you will bring significant contract drafting and negotiation skills, and a good understanding of applicable laws, policies and regulations, to the procurement contract management and advisory capability area. Using your specialized knowledge and in-depth expertise in contract management and procurement overall, you will help to ensure contracting that best manages business, legal and compliance risks, while driving pragmatic solutions to help internal stakeholders avoid unnecessary or burdensome processes and delays. 

You will drive collaboration with procurement, legal and business stakeholders, supporting their contracting needs by creating and providing tools, templates, playbooks, advice and counsel, and assistance with complex drafting and negotiating, enabling efficient and compliant contracting.

In addition, you will work actively with the Contract Capability Lead and Legal to ensure contracts, tools, templates, playbooks, and positions are in line with legal requirements, Roche policies, and company needs as well as suggest enhancements and update. 

You will lead and manage a procurement contracting team, managing resource assignment and talent development to optimize overall resource utilization for your Delivery team while ensuring alignment with the overall Capability approach and priorities as well as team member competencies and development needs. Google-Anwendungen sowie relevanten GMP-Systemen wie Veeva).   • Erhöhung der Anlagenverfügbarkeit durch Mitarbeit und Umsetzung von kontinuierlichen Verbesserungsmaßnahmen (KVP) wie z.B. Verwaltung von Ersatz- und Verschleissteilen oder Erstellen und optimieren von Wartungsplänen

  • Mind. 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung, idealerweise in der pharmazeutischen Produktion (sterile Abfüllung) oder in einem stark regulierten Umfeld

  • Eine Weiterbildung zum Meister ist von Vorteil

  • Sehr gute Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch in Wort und Schrift

  • Englischkenntnisse von Vorteil

title: Senior Process Engineer
description:
Bei Roche kannst du ganz du selbst sein und wirst für deine einzigartigen Qualitäten geschätzt. Unsere Kultur fördert persönlichen Ausdruck, offenen Dialog und echte Verbindungen. Hier wirst du für das, was du bist, wertgeschätzt, akzeptiert und respektiert. Dies schafft ein Umfeld, in dem du sowohl persönlich als auch beruflich wachsen kannst. Die Position

As a Senior Process Engineer in Pharmaceutical Development, you are part of the Department “Pharmaceutical Development” in Pharma Technical Development (PTD) and member of the Process Engineering and Manufacturing group in Basel, Switzerland. The department Pharmaceutical Development is responsible for the development of parenteral drug products from Phase 1 up to Launch. Activities encompass formulation and aseptic manufacturing process development for parenteral drug products for all clinical stages and the market and the transfer of product and process to clinical and commercial manufacturing sites.

 

The Opportunity

Support of Pharmaceutical Development and the parenteral DP network with hands on and strategic support in the following activities: 

  • Design and execution of process characterization/process design studies as part of parenteral biologics, synthetic molecule and gene therapy drug product process development

  • Develop in-depth knowledge of process unit operations of drug product manufacturing, establish and update guidance documents, act as a single point of contact and provide support during DP tech transfer activities

  • Continuous Process / Equipment  improvements of all relevant unit operations for the development and manufacturing of large and synthetic molecule parenterals  (at Roche, CMOs & CDMOs)  e.g. in CAPEX / Investment teams, equipment qualification teams, as User Team Lead or Process SPOC  (incl. supporting sustainability goals)

  • Support of establishment of new technologies of all relevant unit operations and/or container-closure components in development & commercial manufacturing in close collaboration with other functions involved

  • Support business and operational excellence by e.g. leading or contributing to structured Root Cause Analysis and Brainstorming exercises. 

 

Who you are

As the successful candidate you hold a Ph.D. or master degree in process engineering, pharmaceutical sciences, chemical process engineering  or related fields and bring a minimum of 5 - 10 years of professional experience (industry) in process engineering / process development of DP manufacturing related fields of parenteral dosage forms for biologics, peptides and small molecules parenterals (including lyophilization / combination products). In addition you bring hands-on experience  (i.e. active participation in related  teams / responsible for the execution) of e.g:
 

  • Parenterals product process improvement & scale up activities in above mentioned technologies  and processes

  • Experience in performing parenterals process equipment qualification activities and demonstrated ability to evaluate technical & Process engineering and SHE risks. 

  • Design / Justification of down-scale models incl. process parameters definition and characterization (User Requirements / Technical Specification) 

  • Troubleshooting activities & Root cause analysis (moderate and actively drive activities with multiple cross functional stakeholders) 

  • Good understanding of common technical standards, GMP, QbD and regulatory requirements of process validation and tech transfers  and equipment design. 

  • Excellent communication skills and collaborative behaviors, as well as excellent stakeholder management skills in combination

  • Willingness to travel internationally (up to 20%)

 

Are you passionate about Technical Development and parenteral DP, please apply!

Our purpose is to create a space for experimentation by coaching and celebrating learnings to build a purpose driven quality community that delivers innovative medicines to patients.

If you have detailed knowledge of GMPs and of biological drug substance and/or parenteral drug product development for pharmaceutical purposes, as well as outstanding interpersonal and negotiating skills, you should apply for this job.

The Sterile Pharma Suite (StePS) Project is an MES (Manufacturing Execution System) implementation at one of the largest Drug Product (DP) sites globally, aimed at driving digital transformation and optimizing processes in the biopharmaceutical industry.

As the MES Integration Lead, you will play a pivotal role in leading the recipe design, testing, and process execution components of our MES implementation. This role offers a unique opportunity to be a key driver in the digital transformation of sterile pharmaceutical manufacturing. Die Position

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love.

That’s what makes us Roche.

In Roche’s Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development organization (pRED), we make transformative medicines for patients in order to tackle some of the world’s toughest unmet healthcare needs. At pRED, we are united by our mission to transform science into medicines. Together, we create a culture defined by curiosity, responsibility and humility, where our talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed.

360 Labs Initiative at a Glance

The 360 Labs are a new capability that is currently being built up within the Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development organization (pRED). The primary mission of this effort is to provide greater access and support for the use of cutting-edge biomedical research technologies by scientists across our discovery portfolio.

The 360 Labs will deliver core scientific technologies, expertise and enabling activities, as well as facilitate knowledge sharing in close collaboration with our therapeutic areas and functions. Our ambition is to bring to life a thriving workplace environment, where your collaborative mindset is as valued as your professional expertise. Our goal is to act as an highly integrated ecosystem, supporting research and development, working collaboratively, and focused on fostering excellence and sustainability. Together, these efforts will serve to increase the speed, enhance the robustness and improve the sustainability of our exploratory research and early discovery activities.

The Opportunity

The Genomics Core Technology Platform of the 360 Labs Chapter in the Strategy, Portfolio & Operations Global Function in pRED is seeking an experienced and collaborative Research Associate to join its dynamic and innovative team. We are looking for individuals that are both highly-motivated and deeply passionate about utilizing Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) technologies to advance our drug discovery programs. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in the life sciences and demonstrated technical and scientific expertise in advanced bulk NGS methodologies. You will work with a sense of urgency as part of a matrix team, collaborating with experts across various therapeutic disease areas and functions to drive drug discovery projects forward. Additionally, you will contribute to the ongoing evolution of the Genomics Core Technology Platform within the pRED organization.

Die Position

You will work within a team of Change Control experts and will collaborate with peers within the function and across the organization to identify, design, and execute fit-for-purpose Change Control solutions within the strategic framework set by the Quality Process Owner (QPO) for Change Control, driving the delivery and sustainability of a robust and regulatory compliant Quality Management System (QMS) element. You will ensure the timely completion of quality solution deliverables and partner with business/stakeholder, overseeing and providing regulatory and technical expertise in the delivery of high quality processes and solutions. You will contribute to functional, cross-functional, enterprise-wide or external initiatives that shape our technical landscape, business and healthcare environments. You will need strong strategic, collaboration and communication skills, as well as an entrepreneurial mindset, to evolve the way we design and deliver the QMS and to enable accelerated delivery medicines and access for our patients.

The Opportunity

Drive and contribute to continuous improvement and lifecycle management of the quality system (Global standard policies, procedures, IT systems, training, metrics) within the strategic framework set by the Quality Process Owner (QPO) for Change Control with input from:

  • Stakeholder/customer/squad member feedback

  • User input and suggestions

  • Internal and health authority audit observations

  • Self-identified execution issues

  • Changing regulations/requirements

  • Performance as demonstrated through metrics

  • Evaluate and monitor health and implementation of processes to promote both short and long term success to best serve the users.

  • Collaborate with other process responsible colleagues within the QMS and across the organization to deliver compliant solutions.

Who you are

You bring deep expertise in pharmaceutical quality systems, with a strong foundation in GMP regulations and change control. Your ability to build trusted relationships, navigate regulatory landscapes, and apply a risk-based mindset enables you to drive improvements and influence at every level of the organization. With proven experience in health authority interactions and a commitment to clarity, learning, and collaboration, you thrive in complex global environments.

  • Extensive knowledge of change control and GMP-regulated processes

  • Strong grasp of regulatory requirements and risk-based approaches

  • Experience hosting and presenting to Health Authorities

  • Ability to influence across all levels and functions

  • Strong communicator with clarity, transparency, and negotiation skills

  • Demonstrated innovation, flexibility, and collaborative mindset

  • Fluent in English, with readiness to travel (<10%)

  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in aseptischer Herstellung, Reinraumtechnik, Dekontaminationsprozessen und Dekontaminationstechnologien
